rule:
The output must contain a minimum of three

tags.
input: An apple a day keeps the doctor away. Practice makes perfect. Time is gold.
validityText:
The input provided is a paragraph of text containing three sentences: 

1. "An apple a day keeps the doctor away."
2. "Practice makes perfect."
3. "Time is gold."

The input specification requires the text to contain at least three sentences. The given input satisfies this requirement by containing exactly three sentences. Each sentence is complete and is separated by a period, which are common indicators of sentence boundaries in English. The presence of three sentences meets the minimum requirement specified.

Since the input contains at least three sentences, it is in direct compliance with the input specification.

OK
coverageText:
```html

An apple a day keeps the doctor away.

Practice makes perfect.

Time is gold.

```
coverageEvalText:
In evaluating the chatbot output, I have confirmed the following: 1. The output contains at least three

tags, which is a direct requirement of the prompt. There are three

tags present in the output. 2. Each

tag includes one tag, as required. In the first

tag, the tag encloses "apple"; in the second

tag, it encloses "Practice"; and in the third

tag, it encloses "Time". 3. Each

tag also contains at least one tag for emphasizing key words or phrases. In the first

tag, "doctor" is emphasized; in the second, "perfect"; and in the third, "gold". The output specification is met exactly as described. All sentences are wrapped in

tags, each contains one tag, and all sentences contain at least one tag. There are no violations of the described criteria. OK
